overview.description: Nagaland, located in northeastern India, is known for its tribal heritage, hilly terrain, and vibrant Hornbill Festival. Established as a state on December 1, 1963, it features attractions like Kohima and Dimapur.

top_destinations.name: Kohima
top_destinations.description: The capital with World War II Cemetery and Kisama Heritage Village.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit during Hornbill Festival; explore the museum.

top_destinations.name: Dimapur
top_destinations.description: Known for its historical ruins and markets.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit Kachari Ruins; shop at local markets.

top_destinations.name: Mokokchung
top_destinations.description: A cultural hub with scenic hills and villages.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Explore Longkhum village; carry warm clothes.

culinary_delights.name: Smoked Meat Stall
culinary_delights.description: Known for smoked pork and bamboo shoot.

culinary_delights.name: Café Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

culinary_delights.name: De Oriental Grand
culinary_delights.description: Popular for Indian and local fusion.

must_visit_spots.name: Kisama Heritage Village
must_visit_spots.tip: Visit during December for the festival.

must_visit_spots.name: Kohima War Cemetery
must_visit_spots.description: A memorial for World War II soldiers.
must_visit_spots.tip: Pay respects with a quiet visit.

must_visit_spots.name: Dzükou Valley
must_visit_spots.tip: Trek during monsoon for lush greenery.

must_visit_spots.name: Tseminyu
must_visit_spots.description: A cultural village with stone monoliths.

must_visit_spots.name: Japfü Peak
must_visit_spots.description: A trekking spot with stunning views.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Kohima is 270 km from Guwahati (NH29, 6-7 hrs). By train: Nearest railhead Dimapur (70 km). By air: Dimapur Airport.
travel_essentials.tips: Carry warm clothing; book during Hornbill Festival.
